KH.content: Heidegger: chaos, khaos, khaine, signifies the yawning, a split in two, close connection to aletheia, abyss which opens
KH.linkedContent: Heidegger: chaos, khaos, khaine, signifies the yawning, a split in two, close connection to aletheia, abyss which opens

KH.content: for Nietzsche, Chaos prevents a humanization (Vermenschung) of existence in its totality
KH.linkedContent: for Nietzsche, Chaos prevents a humanization (Vermenschung) of existence in its totality

GOD.content: genealogy’s axiom: history never effaces what it buries (enfouit), keeps (garde) secret of what it encrypts, the secret of the secret, c’est une histoire secrète du secret gardé; genealogy is also an economy
GOD.linkedContent: genealogy’s axiom: history never effaces what it buries (enfouit), keeps (garde) secret of what it encrypts, the secret of the secret, c’est une histoire secrète du secret gardé; genealogy is also an economy

GOD.content: Nietzsche’s diagnosis of cruelty is also aimed at economy, speculation, commercial trafficking in institution of morality & justice, & that which exceeds economy as exchange, le commerce du re-merciement [wage, profit of infinite]
GOD.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s diagnosis of cruelty is also aimed at economy, speculation, commercial trafficking in institution of morality & justice, & that which exceeds economy as exchange, le commerce du re-merciement [wage, profit of infinite]

GOD.content: and Christianity’s self-destruction of justice by means of grace
GOD.linkedContent: and Christianity’s self-destruction of justice by means of grace

GOD.content: how can/does Nietzsche believe in the history of the creditor? btwn credit & faith
GOD.linkedContent: how can/does Nietzsche believe in the history of the creditor? btwn credit & faith

R.content: [Marie-Louis Mallet’s orchestration of Cerisy conference a kind of hidden mastery] magic & magisterial wand of a great conductor [Rousseau’s wand]
R.linkedContent: [Marie-Louis Mallet’s orchestration of Cerisy conference a kind of hidden mastery] magic & magisterial wand of a great conductor [Rousseau’s wand]

R.content: voyoucracy, corrupting power of street, not anarchic disorder, but structured disorder, secret society, seducer [hidden master, Versucher]
R.linkedContent: voyoucracy, corrupting power of street, not anarchic disorder, but structured disorder, secret society, seducer [hidden master, Versucher]

FK.content: via Kant’s moral law, Christianity can only answer its moral calling in death of God far beyond figures of the Passion
FK.linkedContent: via Kant’s moral law, Christianity can only answer its moral calling in death of God far beyond figures of the Passion

H.content: p. anne 20 w/out the experience, no ear to listen ~ [annihilation of trace?]
H.linkedContent: p. anne 20 w/out the experience, no ear to listen ~ [annihilation of trace?]

AF.content: discussing Yerushalmi, Derrida emphasizes essential modality “perhaps” for another reason than Nietzsche’s [courage of future philosopher to say perhaps] [elsewhere Derrida certainly emphasizes Nietzsche’s perhaps]
AF.linkedContent: discussing Yerushalmi, Derrida emphasizes essential modality “perhaps” for another reason than Nietzsche’s [courage of future philosopher to say perhaps] [elsewhere Derrida certainly emphasizes Nietzsche’s perhaps]

SPOM.content: Marx’s revolutionary injunction “let the dead bury the dead”, the imperative of an “active forgetting,” as Nietzsche would put it
SPOM.linkedContent: Marx’s revolutionary injunction “let the dead bury the dead”, the imperative of an “active forgetting,” as Nietzsche would put it

BL.content: the height of the human, 2 legs, is what creates repression; turning away is an upward movement, purification, turns away from that which stinks: the history of the law [Derrida says we haven’t paid much attention to hairs inside nose]
BL.linkedContent: the height of the human, 2 legs, is what creates repression; turning away is an upward movement, purification, turns away from that which stinks: the history of the law [Derrida says we haven’t paid much attention to hairs inside nose]

MPM.content: for de Man, Rousseau & Nietzsche both derive transcendental-referent from possibility of making promises [think futurity] [Derrida’s distress over loving both]
MPM.linkedContent: for de Man, Rousseau & Nietzsche both derive transcendental-referent from possibility of making promises [think futurity] [Derrida’s distress over loving both]

MPM.content: de Man: Nietzsche anticipated difference btwn constative/performative in deconstructive gesture, thought of undecidable: deconstruction of illusion that episteme (truth) could be replaced w/doxa (persuasion) [anti-relativism]
MPM.linkedContent: de Man: Nietzsche anticipated difference btwn constative/performative in deconstructive gesture, thought of undecidable: deconstruction of illusion that episteme (truth) could be replaced w/doxa (persuasion) [anti-relativism]

EM.content: Nietzsche: if there is style it must be plural [perhaps we need a change of “style”]
EM.linkedContent: Nietzsche: if there is style it must be plural [perhaps we need a change of “style”]

EM.content: Nietzsche’s übermensch “burns his text and erases the traces of his steps,” a laughter bursting beyond metaphysics
EM.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s übermensch “burns his text and erases the traces of his steps,” a laughter bursting beyond metaphysics

EM.content: is Nietzsche the last metaphysician as Heidegger reads him? or is Heidegger the last sleeping shudder (le dernier sursaut ensommeillé) of the higher man?
EM.linkedContent: is Nietzsche the last metaphysician as Heidegger reads him? or is Heidegger the last sleeping shudder (le dernier sursaut ensommeillé) of the higher man?

VM.content: Nietzsche and Renan reduce Heidegger’s Being to a metaphor by referring to its etymological association w/ respiration [Derrida doubles down on Heidegger’s claim that Nietzsche did not think Being? must find Being in Nietzsche via other roads]
VM.linkedContent: Nietzsche and Renan reduce Heidegger’s Being to a metaphor by referring to its etymological association w/ respiration [Derrida doubles down on Heidegger’s claim that Nietzsche did not think Being? must find Being in Nietzsche via other roads]

S.content: Heidegger saves Nietzsche’s text (from accusation of biologism, zoologism, racism [?]) by damning it: still metaphysics of absolute subjectity like Hegel: Nietzsche’s absolute subjectity that of body, impulsions, affects; Hegel’s that of the willing that knows itself
S.linkedContent: Heidegger saves Nietzsche’s text (from accusation of biologism, zoologism, racism [?]) by damning it: still metaphysics of absolute subjectity like Hegel: Nietzsche’s absolute subjectity that of body, impulsions, affects; Hegel’s that of the willing that knows itself

S.content: is a metaphysics of race less serious than a naturalism or biologism of race? [re: Nietzsche’s “blonde beast”]
S.linkedContent: is a metaphysics of race less serious than a naturalism or biologism of race? [re: Nietzsche’s “blonde beast”]

POOF.content: the all too of Human All Too Human, a rolling wave, a trembling, enveloped violence of a welling up wave falling back on itself, “when the excess of the beyond itself folds back into immanence,” turning around, coming to perhaps
POOF.linkedContent: the all too of Human All Too Human, a rolling wave, a trembling, enveloped violence of a welling up wave falling back on itself, “when the excess of the beyond itself folds back into immanence,” turning around, coming to perhaps

POOF.content: perhaps as non-dialectical passage from one to other that Aristotle can’t think, unable to endure contamination coming from what is beyond both antithetical values > Nietzsche: “Glaube an die Gegensatze der Werthe (faith in antithetical values)”
POOF.linkedContent: perhaps as non-dialectical passage from one to other that Aristotle can’t think, unable to endure contamination coming from what is beyond both antithetical values > Nietzsche: “Glaube an die Gegensatze der Werthe (faith in antithetical values)”

POOF.content: following, not following Nietzsche: paradox of any fidelity
POOF.linkedContent: following, not following Nietzsche: paradox of any fidelity

POOF.content: how Nietzsche’s call to “new philosophers” asks them to come in the future & implies they have already arrived
POOF.linkedContent: how Nietzsche’s call to “new philosophers” asks them to come in the future & implies they have already arrived

POOF.content: philosophers of the future will be at once its [the fundamentally other] figure & responsibility
POOF.linkedContent: philosophers of the future will be at once its [the fundamentally other] figure & responsibility

POOF.content: for Nietzsche, the lookalike caricatures are the worst enemy of what they resemble, i.e. those w/ “democratic sensibility” > Nietzsche responds in name of hyperbole of democracy to unlock, open, this worst repression
POOF.linkedContent: for Nietzsche, the lookalike caricatures are the worst enemy of what they resemble, i.e. those w/ “democratic sensibility” > Nietzsche responds in name of hyperbole of democracy to unlock, open, this worst repression

POOF.content: Nietzsche against the levellers (Nivellirer), those who blame all misery on existing society [they are unfree, no solitude, ludicrously superficial]
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche against the levellers (Nivellirer), those who blame all misery on existing society [they are unfree, no solitude, ludicrously superficial]

POOF.content: at each instant discourse [Nietzsche’s] carried to its limit, on the edge of silence: transports itself beyond itself, hyperbolic, infinite build-up (surenchère), swept away by perhaps that undecides meaning in each decisive moment
POOF.linkedContent: at each instant discourse [Nietzsche’s] carried to its limit, on the edge of silence: transports itself beyond itself, hyperbolic, infinite build-up (surenchère), swept away by perhaps that undecides meaning in each decisive moment

POOF.content: Derrida countersigns Nietzsche [re: arrivant thinkers, new philosophers], extends the duty to countersign again, to us, to me, to you, teleiopoetically: friendship w/out friendship of friends of solitude
POOF.linkedContent: Derrida countersigns Nietzsche [re: arrivant thinkers, new philosophers], extends the duty to countersign again, to us, to me, to you, teleiopoetically: friendship w/out friendship of friends of solitude

POOF.content: Nietzsche: today we even need to be scarecrows, insofar as we are jealous friends of our most midday/midnight solitude > “friends of solitude” even called to be conjurers
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche: today we even need to be scarecrows, insofar as we are jealous friends of our most midday/midnight solitude > “friends of solitude” even called to be conjurers

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s silence (among friends), imperative/enigma of sense of decency (pudeur) [Why I am a Destiny]: an erasure w/out erasure, everything is possible in this silence > silence as interruption that substitutes testimony for know-how, faith for the test, the perhaps for certainty, other for same, friendship for calculation: different way of thinking among
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s silence (among friends), imperative/enigma of sense of decency (pudeur) [Why I am a Destiny]: an erasure w/out erasure, everything is possible in this silence > silence as interruption that substitutes testimony for know-how, faith for the test, the perhaps for certainty, other for same, friendship for calculation: different way of thinking among

POOF.content: no silence among friends w/out laughter, which bares its teeth like death, doing evil & laughing at evil (not laughing it away) among friends
POOF.linkedContent: no silence among friends w/out laughter, which bares its teeth like death, doing evil & laughing at evil (not laughing it away) among friends

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s dissimulation (sage acts the fool), for friendship’s sake be an enemy, knowing how to lie to divert wicked lucidity, dissimulate in order to preserve: feigning to be precisely what he is, he loves them enough not to want to do them all the evil he wants for them
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s dissimulation (sage acts the fool), for friendship’s sake be an enemy, knowing how to lie to divert wicked lucidity, dissimulate in order to preserve: feigning to be precisely what he is, he loves them enough not to want to do them all the evil he wants for them

POOF.content: Nietzsche refers to his friends as brothers (all of Zarathustra read through this figural alignment) > addressees lay down law of genre, so their coming virtues are virile ones
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche refers to his friends as brothers (all of Zarathustra read through this figural alignment) > addressees lay down law of genre, so their coming virtues are virile ones

POOF.content: the 3 ways to see virtue in Nietzsche: 1) deliberate perversion of heritage 2) restoration of meaning perverted by heritage 3) hyperbolic surenchère (more Greek than Greek, more Judeo-Christian than Judeo-Christian) > Nietzsche never discredits virtue
POOF.linkedContent: the 3 ways to see virtue in Nietzsche: 1) deliberate perversion of heritage 2) restoration of meaning perverted by heritage 3) hyperbolic surenchère (more Greek than Greek, more Judeo-Christian than Judeo-Christian) > Nietzsche never discredits virtue

POOF.content: closure & deconstruction (divine microscope) in Nietzsche as he walks down, through, the gauntlet of Christian virtue > must not hesitate to take path of Christian virtue
POOF.linkedContent: closure & deconstruction (divine microscope) in Nietzsche as he walks down, through, the gauntlet of Christian virtue > must not hesitate to take path of Christian virtue

POOF.content: once Nietzsche goes beyond Greek friendship, can we find unity in Greek culture anymore? > when he says, “in honor of friendship,” he knows (better than anyone) he is speaking Greek
POOF.linkedContent: once Nietzsche goes beyond Greek friendship, can we find unity in Greek culture anymore? > when he says, “in honor of friendship,” he knows (better than anyone) he is speaking Greek

POOF.content: [refracting the Aristotlean idea that one must love lovence, that it’s more worthwhile (vaut mieux) to love than to be loved, Derrida continually uses phrase “who better (mieux)” re: Nietzsche, as if extending an ambiguous friendship to him]
POOF.linkedContent: [refracting the Aristotlean idea that one must love lovence, that it’s more worthwhile (vaut mieux) to love than to be loved, Derrida continually uses phrase “who better (mieux)” re: Nietzsche, as if extending an ambiguous friendship to him]

POOF.content: Derrida reads Nietzsche [re: GS 61] as advocating acceptance of gift & dependency,  elevating logic of gift above self-sufficiency of a subject [Greek philosopher who refuses King’s donation], a logic that reorients friendship, calling friendship back to irreducibility of other—but perhaps this installs an irresponsible freedom, madness (friend–enemy), the worst?
POOF.linkedContent: Derrida reads Nietzsche [re: GS 61] as advocating acceptance of gift & dependency, elevating logic of gift above self-sufficiency of a subject [Greek philosopher who refuses King’s donation], a logic that reorients friendship, calling friendship back to irreducibility of other—but perhaps this installs an irresponsible freedom, madness (friend–enemy), the worst?

POOF.content: temptation to match Nietzsche’s gesture, call he seems to be making for another justice, one that breaks w/ equivalence of right & vengeance: what’re political consequences for democracy?
POOF.linkedContent: temptation to match Nietzsche’s gesture, call he seems to be making for another justice, one that breaks w/ equivalence of right & vengeance: what’re political consequences for democracy?

POOF.content: [continuing w/ indefensible bibliophilic discretion] Nietzsche marks a mutation in the political, who better than he marked our history as a history of political linked to love, friend, enemy via Jew, Greek, Christian > binding/unbinding of this link; p. 80 who better than he showed friend/enemy passing into each other: still, the individual ‘Nietzsche’ not the only witness
POOF.linkedContent: [continuing w/ indefensible bibliophilic discretion] Nietzsche marks a mutation in the political, who better than he marked our history as a history of political linked to love, friend, enemy via Jew, Greek, Christian > binding/unbinding of this link; p. 80 who better than he showed friend/enemy passing into each other: still, the individual ‘Nietzsche’ not the only witness

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s overturning, [via dangerous perhaps], brought off in ‘field’ w/out limit, w/out assured, reassuring, ground—all the more finite for this very fact: a world that no longer holds together, one that resembles chaotic madness, disorder, randomness
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s overturning, [via dangerous perhaps], brought off in ‘field’ w/out limit, w/out assured, reassuring, ground—all the more finite for this very fact: a world that no longer holds together, one that resembles chaotic madness, disorder, randomness

POOF.content: what Nietzsche augurs exceeds the name Nietzsche
POOF.linkedContent: what Nietzsche augurs exceeds the name Nietzsche

POOF.content: we tremble in time of Nietzsche’s mutation, we belong (w/out belonging) to this tremor, absolute dislocation, borderless disjoining; we emit warnings, like searchlights w/out coast, mad, impossible pleas: recurrent syntagms of “X without X” (harbor invisible in their very light) > are these watchmen [Bataille, Blanchot, Nancy] guiding us toward another destination [?]
POOF.linkedContent: we tremble in time of Nietzsche’s mutation, we belong (w/out belonging) to this tremor, absolute dislocation, borderless disjoining; we emit warnings, like searchlights w/out coast, mad, impossible pleas: recurrent syntagms of “X without X” (harbor invisible in their very light) > are these watchmen [Bataille, Blanchot, Nancy] guiding us toward another destination [?]

POOF.content: the gift is that which gives friendship in Nietzsche > and yet, friendship still means freedom, equality, fraternity in Nietzsche
POOF.linkedContent: the gift is that which gives friendship in Nietzsche > and yet, friendship still means freedom, equality, fraternity in Nietzsche

POOF.content: quoting Matthew, Derrida asks whether there isn't still profit of a sublime economy, economy beyond economy, in Nietzsche? or does the absolute gift (advising against love of one’s neighbor) break the ruse of this sublime economy? like Kant, isn’t there still best exchange rate for virtue?
POOF.linkedContent: quoting Matthew, Derrida asks whether there isn't still profit of a sublime economy, economy beyond economy, in Nietzsche? or does the absolute gift (advising against love of one’s neighbor) break the ruse of this sublime economy? like Kant, isn’t there still best exchange rate for virtue?

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s gift must also belong to a finite world > how to think dissymmetry of gift w/out exchange, infinite disproportion, from vantage point of terrestrial finitude? under its horizon w/out horizon [see p. 263] > infinitization itself is suspected of being an economic ruse, perverse seduction, stratagem, of loving one’s neighbor
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s gift must also belong to a finite world > how to think dissymmetry of gift w/out exchange, infinite disproportion, from vantage point of terrestrial finitude? under its horizon w/out horizon [see p. 263] > infinitization itself is suspected of being an economic ruse, perverse seduction, stratagem, of loving one’s neighbor

POOF.content: Nietzsche: you must understand how to be a sponge if you want to be loved by overflowing hearts > Nietzsche: in your friend you should love the Superman as your principle
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche: you must understand how to be a sponge if you want to be loved by overflowing hearts > Nietzsche: in your friend you should love the Superman as your principle

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s friend of most distant belongs to finite earth (not world of Christian hinterworld) > friend’s finitude infinitizes the gift he gives [infinite differance is finite] : a friend who doesn’t give you the world (a finite one), gives you nothing [this is neither Greek nor Christian]
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s friend of most distant belongs to finite earth (not world of Christian hinterworld) > friend’s finitude infinitizes the gift he gives [infinite differance is finite] : a friend who doesn’t give you the world (a finite one), gives you nothing [this is neither Greek nor Christian]

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s Superman: awaited because he is origin/cause of man, Ursache, this friend promised via messianico-teleiopeotic perhaps, immemorially past > this friendship to come would still be too human, still deserves name ‘friendship’ [anthropological, humanist character of friendship is situated/delimited here, friendship of proximity/presence]
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s Superman: awaited because he is origin/cause of man, Ursache, this friend promised via messianico-teleiopeotic perhaps, immemorially past > this friendship to come would still be too human, still deserves name ‘friendship’ [anthropological, humanist character of friendship is situated/delimited here, friendship of proximity/presence]

POOF.content: Derrida has not substituted name Nietzsche for Zarathustra: les choses sont déjà assez imprenables et inappropriables avec chacun d’eux
POOF.linkedContent: Derrida has not substituted name Nietzsche for Zarathustra: les choses sont déjà assez imprenables et inappropriables avec chacun d’eux

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s abyssal altercation w/ Christian fraternity, that we’re tasked to relate ancient & new history (fraternity in Christianity, in Arabo-islamic culture too) > no justification in the shortcoming, the obliged shirking, of this task: nevertheless we believe in the seriousness of the obligation
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s abyssal altercation w/ Christian fraternity, that we’re tasked to relate ancient & new history (fraternity in Christianity, in Arabo-islamic culture too) > no justification in the shortcoming, the obliged shirking, of this task: nevertheless we believe in the seriousness of the obligation

POOF.content: Derrida has insisted that the indefinite recoils (replis) in Zarathustra’s strategy must contain one fold or another that places history of brother in Bible & Koran beside Zarathustra (not in confrontation)
POOF.linkedContent: Derrida has insisted that the indefinite recoils (replis) in Zarathustra’s strategy must contain one fold or another that places history of brother in Bible & Koran beside Zarathustra (not in confrontation)

POOF.content: event of Nietzsche, signatory & witness, cause & effect, of a few unprecedented ruptures/interruptions in place of friendship > yet, interruption/rupture not sufficient to account for where Nietzsche folds into Christianity
POOF.linkedContent: event of Nietzsche, signatory & witness, cause & effect, of a few unprecedented ruptures/interruptions in place of friendship > yet, interruption/rupture not sufficient to account for where Nietzsche folds into Christianity

POOF.content: Blanchot no longer has affinity w/ one Nietzsche (there is always plus d’un): friendship is not a gift or promise
POOF.linkedContent: Blanchot no longer has affinity w/ one Nietzsche (there is always plus d’un): friendship is not a gift or promise

TC.content: interpretive in the Nietzschean sense [see On the Geneal… p. 77]
TC.linkedContent: interpretive in the Nietzschean sense [see On the Geneal… p. 77]

SH.content: meridian binds (Verbindende) at midday the encounter (shortest shadow?) “a date would be the gnomon (nom, shadow) of these meridians”
SH.linkedContent: meridian binds (Verbindende) at midday the encounter (shortest shadow?) “a date would be the gnomon (nom, shadow) of these meridians”

WM.content: by placing metaphor en abyme, Nietzsche is responsible for the need to find a new distinction than that btwn metaphor and concept
WM.linkedContent: by placing metaphor en abyme, Nietzsche is responsible for the need to find a new distinction than that btwn metaphor and concept

WM.content: Nietzsche takes risk of continuity btwn metaphor & concept, describes metaphorical tissue of man as spider’s web, Derrida follows web, tissu, tisser, to weave, honey bees, Marx
WM.linkedContent: Nietzsche takes risk of continuity btwn metaphor & concept, describes metaphorical tissue of man as spider’s web, Derrida follows web, tissu, tisser, to weave, honey bees, Marx

DS.content: difference  is the necessary interval, suspense btwn 2 outcomes, “lapse of time” btwn 2 shots, rolls, chances > a game of chance forever new, a play of fire forever young > fire & games (via Nietzsche, Heraclitus), play of luck w/ necessity: a hymen btwn chance & rule
DS.linkedContent: difference is the necessary interval, suspense btwn 2 outcomes, “lapse of time” btwn 2 shots, rolls, chances > a game of chance forever new, a play of fire forever young > fire & games (via Nietzsche, Heraclitus), play of luck w/ necessity: a hymen btwn chance & rule

POS.content: Derrida is “above all” made possible by Heidegger’s ontological difference (the unthought difference btwn Being and beings), yet Nietzsche is “perhaps” a move beyond the ontotheology of Heidegger, toward a differance no longer in language of West
POS.linkedContent: Derrida is “above all” made possible by Heidegger’s ontological difference (the unthought difference btwn Being and beings), yet Nietzsche is “perhaps” a move beyond the ontotheology of Heidegger, toward a differance no longer in language of West

SP.content: mustn’t we reconcile Nietzsche’s apparently feminist propositions w/ his overwhelming corpus of “venomous (acharné) anti-feminism” > question still remains: de ce que je fais ici en ce moment
SP.linkedContent: mustn’t we reconcile Nietzsche’s apparently feminist propositions w/ his overwhelming corpus of “venomous (acharné) anti-feminism” > question still remains: de ce que je fais ici en ce moment

SP.content: Heidegger’s 3 warnings on reading Nietzsche: 1.	simply aestheticizing his work as philosopher-artist would corroborate current order of philosophy 2.	do not confuse “heroic-boastful” style (pseudo-transgressive exuberance) for “grand style” 3.	must read Nietzsche as unremitting interrogation of Western civilization
SP.linkedContent: Heidegger’s 3 warnings on reading Nietzsche: 1. simply aestheticizing his work as philosopher-artist would corroborate current order of philosophy 2. do not confuse “heroic-boastful” style (pseudo-transgressive exuberance) for “grand style” 3. must read Nietzsche as unremitting interrogation of Western civilization

SP.content: Heidegger’s 3 propositions related to these warnings: 1. there’s only been a philosopher before art, a gossiping woman, a sterile woman (not a männliche Mutter); acc. Nietzsche, the old aesthetic nothing but that of passive, receptive consumers 2. Nietzsche’s art would be “metaphysical in its most intimate intention” 3. Nietzsche deals (most frequently) w/ Plato by simple inversion (Umdrehung), standing Platonic propositions on their head
SP.linkedContent: Heidegger’s 3 propositions related to these warnings: 1. there’s only been a philosopher before art, a gossiping woman, a sterile woman (not a männliche Mutter); acc. Nietzsche, the old aesthetic nothing but that of passive, receptive consumers 2. Nietzsche’s art would be “metaphysical in its most intimate intention” 3. Nietzsche deals (most frequently) w/ Plato by simple inversion (Umdrehung), standing Platonic propositions on their head

SP.content: Heidegger oscillates btwn reading in Nietzsche a simple Umdrehung (inversion) of Plato or something other > neither a direct flipping, nor an an-archical erasure of hierarchy (which consolidates established order), but “a transformation of hierarchical structure itself”
SP.linkedContent: Heidegger oscillates btwn reading in Nietzsche a simple Umdrehung (inversion) of Plato or something other > neither a direct flipping, nor an an-archical erasure of hierarchy (which consolidates established order), but “a transformation of hierarchical structure itself”

SP.content: acc. Heidegger, Nietzsche belongs to metaphysics because his thought aimed to culminate it [Derrida asks whether belonging has one value, and, if so, would it carry belonging beyond itself]
SP.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, Nietzsche belongs to metaphysics because his thought aimed to culminate it [Derrida asks whether belonging has one value, and, if so, would it carry belonging beyond itself]

SP.content: “steps of the dove (colombe),” which is the manner of the Übermensch, leads Derrida to “pun”: we could begin a discourse on Nietzsche’s columbarium (colombaire)
SP.linkedContent: “steps of the dove (colombe),” which is the manner of the Übermensch, leads Derrida to “pun”: we could begin a discourse on Nietzsche’s columbarium (colombaire)

SP.content: never has been the style, the woman, the simulacrum, the sexual difference [un gai savoir]
SP.linkedContent: never has been the style, the woman, the simulacrum, the sexual difference [un gai savoir]

OTO.content: Nietzsche put his name on the line, staged signatures, made an immense bio-graphical paraph > [Derrida mentions this not to guarantee him a profit, return]
OTO.linkedContent: Nietzsche put his name on the line, staged signatures, made an immense bio-graphical paraph > [Derrida mentions this not to guarantee him a profit, return]

OTO.content: name’s genius still there to make us forget his death
OTO.linkedContent: name’s genius still there to make us forget his death

OTO.content: to be dead, no return can come to the bearer of the name
OTO.linkedContent: to be dead, no return can come to the bearer of the name

OTO.content: only the name can inherit, so the name is always a dead man’s name
OTO.linkedContent: only the name can inherit, so the name is always a dead man’s name

OTO.content: Nietzsche’s name has poisoned milk in it, its legacy, mixed up in advance w/ worst of our times, and not by accident
OTO.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s name has poisoned milk in it, its legacy, mixed up in advance w/ worst of our times, and not by accident

OTO.content: Dionysus vs. Crucified, name of versus, countername, suffices to pluralize (in a singular fashion) homonymic mask & proper name, to lead all threads of name astray in labyrinth (ear)
OTO.linkedContent: Dionysus vs. Crucified, name of versus, countername, suffices to pluralize (in a singular fashion) homonymic mask & proper name, to lead all threads of name astray in labyrinth (ear)

OTO.content: cannot think nor hear Nietzsche’s name w/out reaffirmation of the hymen, alliance or wedding ring, eternal return
OTO.linkedContent: cannot think nor hear Nietzsche’s name w/out reaffirmation of the hymen, alliance or wedding ring, eternal return

OTO.content: Nietzsche said it all (more or less), the most mutually incompatible things, his contradicting duplicity: he said that he said them > all statements before & after are at once possible
OTO.linkedContent: Nietzsche said it all (more or less), the most mutually incompatible things, his contradicting duplicity: he said that he said them > all statements before & after are at once possible

OTO.content: btwn his living mother and his dead father, this is Nietzsche’s chance
OTO.linkedContent: btwn his living mother and his dead father, this is Nietzsche’s chance

OTO.content: Nietzsche’s living mother/dead father, identity as double & neutral; “I know both, I am both” [“both” must be read as singular] > la vie la mort: the dead man the living feminine
OTO.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s living mother/dead father, identity as double & neutral; “I know both, I am both” [“both” must be read as singular] > la vie la mort: the dead man the living feminine

OTO.content: alliance in which Nietzsche seals/forges his signatures, and simulates them: demonic neutrality of midday delivered from the negative and from dialectic
OTO.linkedContent: alliance in which Nietzsche seals/forges his signatures, and simulates them: demonic neutrality of midday delivered from the negative and from dialectic

OTO.content: Nietzsche: “I have a subtler sense of smell for the signs of ascent and decline”
OTO.linkedContent: Nietzsche: “I have a subtler sense of smell for the signs of ascent and decline”

OTO.content: institutions of “yes,” have need of ears: Nietzsche doesn’t expect the ears and hands for his truths today—my small ears no small interest to ladies, makes me a monster, anti-ass, Anti-Christ
OTO.linkedContent: institutions of “yes,” have need of ears: Nietzsche doesn’t expect the ears and hands for his truths today—my small ears no small interest to ladies, makes me a monster, anti-ass, Anti-Christ

OTO.content: for Nietzsche, culture (Bildung) begins when we know how to treat the living as living; Derrida discusses a pact, alliance, contract, a hymen w/ living language, w/ mother (tongue), against death (father): even good master of history (science of the father) trains for the sake of mother tongue, must know when to suppress ‘historical interest’ for culture to begin

OTO.content: phoenix motif [in Nietzsche]: one burns what is already dead, the appearance of life, so living feminine can be reborn in these ashes [cf. EN]
OTO.linkedContent: phoenix motif [in Nietzsche]: one burns what is already dead, the appearance of life, so living feminine can be reborn in these ashes [cf. EN]

OTO.content: Derrida compares phoenix motif to Nietzsche’s call to actively destroy/forget Zarathustra, & to training methods, a treatment of the body (via tongue, ear) > must destroy selectively, the degenerate, which offers itself to annihilation, Entartung as life principle hostile to life [cf. GM]

OTO.content: [re: fact that Nazis could ape Nietzsche’s text] if you refuse conscious, deliberate textual intentions, the perversion is made possible by structure of text itself (its “remaining”), otherwise it would be unreadable > nothing absolutely contingent about fact that Nazis effectively brandished his name [Derrida wary of close reading that would preserve Nietzsche’s intention]

ATIA.content: to “let” something “be” “as such,” you would have to “let be” in your absence, in your death [thus, for Heidegger, being-toward-death and “as such” constitutive of each other], but is this ever possible? can we let the being be? Nietzsche would say no, that the objective is always caught in the living, in life, in perspective > whatever the difference btwn animals, remains an “animal” relation

BSi.content: nonknowledge of bête, spirit of seminar; the living in life itself outplays opposition btwn bêtise and its supposed contrary > Nietzsche one of most eloquent witnesses of this theme: both man & animal, both idiotic & cunning—no decidable limit

BSi.content: Nietzsche’s superman, and the sovereign too, a hyperbolic, sublime, “higher than height,” more about excess than height, it’s the more than that counts, the surplus, absolutely more: could as well be a maximum of smallness, God as small (sovereign use of nanotechnology)

OG.linkedContent: Heidegger’s reading of Nietzschean demolition irrefutable if it remains confined to metaphysical edifice, entirely other if one accepts the deconstruction at hand > is Nietzsche captive or deconstructive?

OG.content: Nietzsche contributed great deal to liberating signifier from dependence on logos (in relation to truth, primary signified) > to save Nietzsche from Heidegger’s reading (N. remains simply w/in metaphysics), we need to understand how a step out of metaphysics must still utilize it in a certain way, perhaps we should offer Nietzsche up to Heidegger’s reading entirely

OG.content: the hesitation of Heidegger & Nietzsche is not “incoherence,” it is the trembling of deconstruction: deconstruction does not destroy structures from the inside, must inhabit, inhabits most when one doesn’t suspect it > borrow all subversive strategies from old structure
